intro: Galium anglicum var. parisiense, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsules as its fruit. Galium anglicum var. parisiense is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
